condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.3. Guidance, tools and resources to effectively generate, analyze, and utilize statistical and qualitative information for Child Rights Monitoring system are available in the country.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued to support the strengthening of Albania's mechanisms for child rights monitoring and reporting at national and subnational level, with two major Government's Reports about children released within the year. UNICEF contributed directly to enrich the availability of the data for measuring progress on SDGs and the impact of national policies and actions on children. New partnerships at municipal level have been established in the framework of Child Friendly City Initiative, paving the path towards joint programming and implementation for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of systems/mechanisms/capacities to routinely collect, analyse and publish child-rights indicators
The extent to which the Situation Analysis informs UNICEF's interventions
